page.title: 01VALE OF CLWYD-INTRODUCTION.
page.content: This well wooded block is situated in the Vale of Clwyd just East of Denbigh{The River Clwyd}flows S-N on the West side & most of the surrounding heavy,fertile land belongs to a large estate.On the East side are the lower slopes of the{Clwydian { Hills.}Here are smaller farms or holdings, & ordinary houses & holiday homes dating from the{17th. century on. Farming is mainly sheep dairy & beef cattle and some arable. Villages lie outside the block to the N & S.The B5429 connecting them is the only classified road.The area is rural, with few amenities no public transport parement, streetlight, or public phone and in some cases no mains water. There are two postboxes. The only sign of past industry is an{iron mine {shaft},disused for 100 years.
